title: Swift diagnosis and fantastic specialist services
body:
Late last year was referred to the Norfolk and Norwich Hospital  for ongoing, but not severe, symptoms.  After a thorough examination the neurologist seemed reassured there were no underlying conditions but responded to our concerns by referring me for a brain scan, “to put your mind at rest”.

I was telephoned within a week of the scan by a consultant who told me I had a benign meningioma; I was given an appointment at clinic the following day and an immediate referral to Addenbrookes Hospital, being seen within the next two days. The tumour was removed at Addenbrookes on 7th January and I initially recovered well and was discharged after a week.  However an infection necessitated a re-admission to Addenbrookes with 3-4 days of intensive investigations to ascertain the reason for my rapidly deteriorating condition. A further operation on 16th February found infected matter and over the course of the following week the precise antibiotic regime was established and I began to stabilise. In total I spent nearly 4 weeks this year at Addenbrookes, on Wards A3/A4. The treatment I received was second to none, and the care of the staff at all times was considerate and patient. The generous visiting hours enable patients to be fully supported by family which we found hugely beneficial.
Please pass on my appreciation to everyone on the neurology team, and to all the staff on the Wards.  And to you, and the executives for leading a good hospital with ground-breaking research and treatment initiatives.  I have been very fortunate to have had such good treatment and I know I am not alone.

readBy.name: Cambridge University Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Constant problems with dispensary
body: Vast improvement now that you fill in a form to request a ring back. Previously it was nigh on impossible to get through by phone. However, once you have seen the doctor and been prescribed medicine, you problems really do begin. Unlike any other surgery I know, prescriptions go through the dispensary rather than straight to your chosen pharmacy. Repeat prescriptions must also be submitted to the dispensary to be signed off. This is when your repeat prescription will quite often vanish, leaving you, me and many others regularly having to chase up vital medicines. It is stressful and completely unnecessary. There is no appetite to change or improve this situation despite being ongoing for years. Even the doctor rolled his eyes when I spoke to him about it, which tells me that the Practice Manager is neither engaged nor cares a jot about efficiency or best practise. Also, avoid Lloyds Pharmacy. The combination of them and the dispensary will drive you to tears. I await a repeat prescription now that was requested nearly 2 weeks ago, for vital drugs that I will run out of very soon. I wonder if the form I filled in (the only means of communication with the dispensary) will even make a difference. We need another surgery in Attleborough soon. I'd be rattling their doors to transfer. I expect the manager will now tell me how happy patients are in surveys and what a marvellous team the dispensary is. I'm afraid your reputation says otherwise and everyone knows it. It's a shame you don't try to do anything about it.

title: No knowledge of Poly Myositis
body:
I came in for an MRI scan. I am grateful to the NHS and the heroes working but....l
I have been diagnosed with Poly Myositis and needed images on both legs.
My condition is rare but the Radiographer seemed to have no idea of how it affects patients. No strength in the core muscles top of legs hips or top of arms.
She eventually picked my legs up onto the bed after I asked for help but in doing so I fell backwards which caused my neck to kick back without support. I felt vulnerable as she told me to “move down” on the bed again something difficult with no strength.
She gave me headphones but did not communicate with me during the scan until the end telling me I had 6 minutes left and I was doing well. 
As I was extremely nervous which she was told she gave no reassurance to me and I was crying as I laid there. I had suffered a panic attack previously in the scanner.
After the “ordeal” was finished she did not attempt to assist me to get off the bed again until I asked for help and from that..l I was told the entrance was “over there” and as I could not put my shoes on by myself there was no attempt to help me. No one supported me up the corridor back to the waiting room or checked that I was safe as I was shaking and upset. 
The fact of having this scan is traumatic enough but surely staff should be aware of certain conditions that may need them to help more sympathetically and support patients. Also to put patients more at ease ?
I am grateful for this lady working during the pandemic and have utmost praise for all NHS staff. I realise it could be skeleton staff in the department but I am just feeding back that certain conditions need more assistance rather than the unsympathetic person I encountered. 
If I return I will make my needs clearer and if I am unhappy I won’t be returning to Southmead and will choose a different hospital. 
I will also be feeding back to my consultant in Rheumatology. 
It has upset and hurt me (when the website states I would be SUPPORTED during the scan.)
A pleasant lady took details as I first went in but she was not around as I came out? 
Maybe it was not the Radiographer’s job description to give more care but in the absence of a nurse she could have assisted me asked if I was ok as I staggered out with my shoes untied and could have fallen.

title: Very supportive
body:
I was referred for a 14 day cancer appointment I have to say everything went really smoothly I was contacted within the 14 days and had my first appointment after seven days everything was completed within the 14 days.
I have to say I saw more cleaners than I did patients. Everybody seem to be alert friendly and efficient.
This was my second 14 day referral in the last two years and each time I've been really impressed.

readBy.name: Milton Keynes University Hospital NHS Foundation Trust

title: Assessed in 2 hours
body:
I've been a patient of this practice for over 25 years. I have always felt safe in the care of the GPs here. I was last assessed earlier this month - and received an appointment within 2 hours of making it. The doctor who treated me diligently took the time to understand my issues and provide me with thorough and full advice. He then very kindly followed up with me a few days later to check my progress.

I would absolutely recommend this surgery to any individual and/or family as a practice of choice.

title: Great practice great staff
body: This has been my practice for ever and they are just incredible. The place itself is always clean, staff no matter what your there for are always helpful and friendly. Even over the phone always helping and willing to do that bit extra

title: Such incredible staff
body: This was our 4th visit to PAU and Holly Ward due to concerns about our baby boy’s kidneys. Every single time we’ve been greeted with smiles and the kindest staff members. We always feel so safe, looked after and leave feeling so grateful and lucky to have such a great hospital, and outstanding doctors and nurses nearby

readBy.name: North West Anglia NHS Foundation Trust

title: Ambulance
body:
Would like to thank to the kind and understanding service of the ambulance medics came to see our baby today in Kineton
They were very friendly and supportive. Done a great job and wish them all the best.

title: this service must continue
body: I suffer from vaginal atrophy and was referred by my GP to the adult continence service physio clinic in Heaton Norris . The female physio I saw  was wonderful. Vaginal atrophy and prolapse are not an easy thing to talk about but the physio was great and made me feel at ease straightaway. There was no rush with the appointment which lasted over an hour . I was given the option of having an internal examination. It was such a relief to meet a professional who takes this condition seriously and sympathetically. Vaginal dryness is a taboo subject for many and it can be a very embarrassing and awkward to discuss.  My appointment included how to do pelvic floor exercises correctly.  In addition the physio eased my fears about using vaginal oestrogen and also recommended that I try a vaginal moisturiser.  At the end of my appointment I was given a handwritten summary of all that we discussed.  Soon after my appointment I was prescribed the items recommended.  I think the service and support I received  is really valuable and has helped me emotionally and physically and improved my inter personal relationship with my husband. please can you pass on my thanks to the physio I saw at Heaton Norris.

title: Very caring
body: I was admitted as an emergency into Good Hope Ward 16  after suffering burst appendix also was Covid Positive but showing no symptoms, I was in so much pain, the Staff on the Ward was very caring and understanding and dealt with my pain until my Operation, post Op I was again monitored and checked very frequently and felt reassured about everything, I was in patient for three days and felt very grateful to be going home and very appreciative and thankful to the Staff who looked after me.

readBy.name: University Hospitals Birmingham NHS Foundation Trust

title: A ship without a.captain
body: Our mam was in this home for 16 months . In this time we never met the manager once. Because this is owned by a large org the staff are kept in check and told what to say to residents families. The Care Records are not accurate . We regret putting our mam here . Best to choose a privately owned Care Home . This one is all show on the outside but dont be fooled its not what it seems . Complete lack of openness by management .

title: Wellbeing
body: I had to limp into A&E with nerve and tissue damage with extreme pain in my foot. Considering all the additional pressure that the NHS are currently experiencing, the wonderful staff in A&E were so helpful and caring. I would like to thank them all for making my health and wellbeing important to them. The NHS is staffed with absolutely amazing people. Thank you.

readBy.name: University Hospitals Bristol and Weston NHS Foundation Trust

title: Excellent Staff
body:
I had major surgery at the Peter Smith Surgery Centre on Tuesday 5 May 2020. From arriving at 0715 until my discharge on Friday 8 May (much earlier than expected) my treatment could not have been bettered anywhere. After surgery I went to Ward 27 where nothing was to much trouble for the nursing staff. I was treat with efficiency, respect, kindness and friendliness .
I have nothing but praise for the staff, both day and night shift and my undying thanks. My score has to be 12 out of 10

title: Unbeatable care!
body: Wow... where to start! From antenatal. Delivery, postnatal to Neonatal... every single member of staff deserves recognition! It has been one of the most positive experiences even through covid. The staff here go above and beyond and the nursing and care is first class. The recent newspapers re historical cases are so bias, these people are working day and night to provide first class care and get no recognition for it! Please please look after your staff in theee departments as they are doing you proud everyday! I have a list of names of the ladies that looked after me and my premature baby.... he is still in there and I can’t see him as much as I want or with my husband but I take great comfort in the fact that he is being looked after by the best!

readBy.name: Shrewsbury and Telford Hospital NHS Trust

title: A Practice Performing Very Well At Full Capacity.…
body: It’s all too easy to complain and criticise these days, especially when everyone is under stress, and the pressure to deliver a better quality of service for much less money, takes its toll, but I have to say that when you’ve worked in public service, as I have, you come to understand the difficulties faced by an NHS surgery bursting at the seams. Yes, Sunbury Health Centre has had its issues, but anyone can see the strides they’ve made in improving, throughout all areas of service delivery. No system is perfect when having to cater for a wide reaching community, but I am so grateful to the Doctors, Nurses and Support staff that continue to serve us in tough and uncertain times. The partners, management and stake holders have increased staffing levels in reception, taken on more support staff to assist with enquiries, to free up doctors and nursing staff to focus on patient care. They have taken on board all the feedback provided by the extended community and have worked tirelessly to address our concerns. Life is challenging and stressful and illness and injury can have life threatening and life changing implications that make it difficult to be cheerful. But with us as grateful patients, who let’s not forget, need this practice, along with the understanding from and towards all practice staff, a fine balance can hopefully be met. Philosophy says, “Empathy has an amazing power for social change. We never really know what’s going on for others and won’t even begin to understand a person until we’ve walked a mile in their shoes.” So maybe we can give each other a thought and that consideration when we next feel aggrieved, angered, upset or hurt by someone. To end, I’d like to say thank you to all the staff at Sunbury Health Centre, for your contribution towards making it a practice that, I am for one, immensely proud of.

title: We are so lucky to have St Mary's!
body:
I gave birth to my son in March and cannot praise the staff at St Mary's more highly. The midwives (and student midwives) were absolutely amazing - attentive, compassionate and so kind and reassuring throughout a 24 hour labour which spanned 2 shifts! 

 I was very anxious due to a history of miscarriage and the midwives were fantastic in their responses - I could not have asked for better care. They put me on a monitor so I could hear the baby's heartbeat at all times and were constantly reassuring and encouraging - I am in awe of them and could not be more grateful for the care I received.

 I ended up being taken to theatre after my baby turned during labour - this terrified me but was handled calmly and with flawless expertise and competence. Everyone I met worked seamlessly together to deliver my baby safely and I felt so safe in their hands.  Looking back it was all a bit traumatic as I lost a lot of blood but the calmness and care of the team meant that this didn't impact upon the joy of hearing that long-awaited cry and being able to hold our rainbow baby at last.
Postnatal care continued to be outstanding - due to the blood loss I had one-to-one care and a private room for the first 24 hours which was amazing and really helped me as a first time mum to get the hang of breast-feeding and for my son to be thoroughly checked over. I was then moved to the ward where the staff continued to be supportive and caring, despite being extremely busy. We received many regular visits from midwives/nurses/doctors/physios - the standard of care was truly first rate! Since returning home this has continued and I am still being supported in my recovery with regular contact and swift referrals being made. Particularly given that the country went into lockdown in the week following the birth this kind of support has been invaluable.

I cannot praise St Mary's highly enough or thank them enough for helping me to become a parent when at times this seemed an impossible dream. We are so lucky to have St Mary's and its staff deserve the finest of commendations.

Thank you from the bottom of our hearts.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2020)

author: Uncle G
title: Thank you CGL
body: During cv19 they put my medication to monthly pick up and it helped me out a great deal and really appreciate it thanks cgl stecford

title: Poor
body: I had a scan back in January and came into the practice to see if they had heard anything back. I got told by the receptionist I have and that I need to make an appointment with the doctor due to receptionists not been trained with medical advice which is totally understandable but every time I called I could never get an appointment or appointments which were available I couldn’t do due to work. I understand at these times with the covid 19 that’s going on it is difficult to get through As the lines are probably busy but I’ve tried to get through to Secretary a numerous amount of times and automatically cuts off and I’ve tried other ways to get though then I’ll be in a waiting list for about 15 mins then end up getting cut off and I have anxiety and not knowing what my results are still after 4 months is difficult.

title: Very good service
body:
In the last year there has been such an improvement at this practice. 
The phone is answered, the reception staff are polite, efficient and you can see them working as a team. The systems are explained very clearly. The GP was calm and gave me time to talk, and gave good advice and was clear about the referral and then took time after hours to call me back. The associate physician was professional and knowledgeable and checked with the GP when she needed authorisation of the next steps/referral. I no longer dread having to visit or ring the surgery. Thank you very much as I can imagine it's not easy to run and work in a busy surgery.  I hope this good service continues.

title: Fantastic servixe
body: Wanted to give a huge thank you to the reception staff and dr who made a quick diagnosis for us last week. Thank you for being so kind and diligent. I’ve been with Grove Village for many years and have always received excellent care. Thank you!

title: Nurse Practitioner / Terrible Telephone Manner .
body: All of the GPS that I gave either spoken with over the telephone and also surgery visits have been very helpful and professional, however after a telephone consultation I recieved this morning with a nurse practitioner I feel very upset , she was abrupt , didn’t give me time to explain my concerns , didn’t seem interested in allowing me time , and made remarks about my health and questioned it , without giving me the time or the patience so as I could explain my situation to her , I know at this current time and crisis when contacting GP surgeries you cannot ask to speak with a GP or Health Professional of choice but I hope that I am not as unfortunate again as to have to speak with this Prescribing Nurse at a time when I am really struggling .

author: Lysleigh
title: Help me to forget and forgive
body:
I gave Birth to my second child at Wexham Maternity, I am french and in france many mothers have epidurals, same thing, 2 anesthesists per service in France...It was 9 months ago, I thought I would never write. But today I need it as I am bitter. That was what I wanted, like my first birth : no bath birth, no jazz music, not a special position or special wishes.... just an epidural. Like for my first child I had to be induced... The pain when you are induced is stronger as contractions are so close they give you no rest! The first birth I gave in france was a dream to me! In England they told me write your birth plan in front of your book! That's the only thing I wrote : please give me an epidural!  
I didn't have any, my midwife as soon as I came in the room, I asked for the epidural... I knew it was gonna quickly be very painful, I asked it like I did in France when I entered the labour room.  
The midwife ignored me... I cant even remember what she said... something vague... basically I had to wait ... see how it would go. When I explained I was french and in France we easily have it... she just said : things are different in here. Then I felt ignored and I started to get scared.  
They gave me the gas.. I started to be in unbearable pain an hour later and insisted but the anestesist is busy.. there was always a reason... came after a few hours I cried to see them so much...my happiness was short... there wasn't time to give me epidural... was then called for an emergency. Now I will never forget that feeling : anaesthetist is gone... I felt like being on a torture table... 5 of my nails have been taken I have an other five to go... the anesthesia will not come... I begged my husband to find a solution someone to listen to me ... he was powerless.  
Everything accelerate, the rhythm of the baby’s heart rate drops... emergency C-section...I go in the theatre... but baby too engaged I have to push! I pushed .... as much as I possibly could... nothing...head of the baby stuck backward... They have to use a ventouse, have to have a horse episiotomy... and there he is! At 11pm my son is born.  
... Now this is the last part I wont forget... the midwife tells me : « YOUR PUSHING WAS RUBBISH » thank you ...really for this moment !  
I came into the post-birth ward..had to stay there one week as the episiotomy got infected... I have seen so many women coming there so happy cuddling and thanking their midwife...  
Recently read an article about how some maternity in england try and avoid to give the epidural...  
Whatever the reason are believe me they are not good enough to replace the post-traumatic birth I have lived and this feeling to not be listened to for something so important! I am angry and it has been 9 months  
I have to say people were really nice in the post-birth section... they have seen me miserable and crying for days and told me to write a review... I never found the strength... hopefully doing this now will help me to forget and forgive.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2020)

author: Onlywayisup
title: Crisis team are fantastic
body: After 2 suicide attempts and self harming, the crisis team came to ky house daily to start with and delivered my medication weekly so I hadnt enough medication to attempt another overdose with. The staff who came were different people each time but not once did I have to repeat my story to them. They were clearly very well informed and aware of my situation. At one point I said I still felt quite anxious so they went back to the doctor and sought advice. My medication was immediately increased to a higher dose and delivered the next morning. They clearly have my welfare at heart. I am now on weekly visits but I know I can ring them for support at any time, which I have still done when I've had wobbles. I've heard a lot of bad press about the crisis team but I honestly cant speak more highly of them. They are with me every step of the way until I'm ready to continue my journey in my GPs care. Dont be afraid to call them. They're fantastic.

author: Lily bloom
title: My pregnancy termination and how I was treated
body: The first nurse I had was really lovely and was explaining to me the procedures, was very caring and very comforting. However I felt that the second staff member was really horrible and mean to me, during my scan using a raised voice because I wasn’t completely still because I was crying, kept getting frustrated with me because I felt overwhelmed and didn’t help to calm me down but instead made me feel like I was to blame. At the end of the scan, this staff several times said that I didn't “look my age“. I was 18 at the time, now I’m 19 looking back now I wish I had complained because I don’t think such a inconsiderate manner is appropriate at an abortion clinic .

title: Lack of communication :
body:
Due to the Corona virus I had a telephone appointment on 06/04/20. I  had a call prior to this and was asked to be available from 9-30 am to 11-30 am I did not  receive the call, for the next 2/3 weeks I made several calls with no answer so left a voice message on each call still no reply.Eventually I received a call with an apology and that this would be dealt with, this was at least 2 weeks ago still no appointment call or communication so continue to suffer with the pain and discomfort.
I understand the situation with the Corona Pandemic but surely a 2 minute call or text even should not be a problem.
Very disappointed with this lack of service.

author: J-99
title: Indifferent to patients needs
body:
My mother-in-law is in this hospital. There appears to be very little care whatsoever. She is not being given the painkillers that she is supposed to have. When she pointed out to a staff member that she had not had her painkillers the staff member said that they would check. No painkillers appeared for the rest of the day.  
Sitting is painful, yet after being helped to get up in the morning she is left in a chair and not helped to get back to bed to lie down.  
At mealtimes there's a curt "Do you want soup?"  
No real care. Staff apparently indifferent to patients needs, seemingly finding the patients an inconvenience rather than people who they are supposed to be caring for.

readBy.name: St. Andrews University ScotGEM Medical Students

author: Judy ET
title: 12 days in a wonderful hospice
body: Following spontaneous fractures on 5 spinal vertebrae I was in extreme pain. Several weeks of increasing medication had little effect. I was offered a period in St Luke's Hospice (Harrow) to try to arrive at a better regime of pain control. After 12 days I am home and in a much better condition. The care and attention shown to me reinforced the excellent reputation of our local hospice. During this time of coronavirus a hospital stay was out of the question. Thanks to the kindness and expertise of the doctors, nurses and others at St Luke's I have been released from total pain and am in a much better place. Not cured of the breaks, of course, nor of my other underlying blood cancer, but life is worth living again. And that is a wonderful result.

author: jwat234
title: They said there was nothing they could do
body: We had a terrible experience. My daughter was seen by CAMHS for one appointment. She was, and still is, really low in mood, but they said there was nothing they could do for her and fobbed her off. She is getting worse with the way things are just now but because of the way she was treated I cant get her to agree to trying again for help.

author: Tb91
title: Bringing people together
body: I attended Inclusion aldershot music group. Great way to bring people together, fun and creative + a really good instructor

author: Teri91
title: Having a baby boy
body: Back at the end of December 2019 I gave birth to my second baby here. Upon arrival I met Maggie who assessed me and made me feel very comfortable and relaxed. I was then moved to ward 17 were Dawn looked after me, I wasn’t in the ward long as I was allowed to walk around the hospital and started to progress quickly. When I was ready for the labour suite Joan came and collected me to take me through and get me comfortable. I took great comfort in her care and seemed familiar with her face as I think she helped deliver my first baby back in 2011! Her nature was very relaxed, friendly yet professional. She took great care of me and also made sure my birthing partners were looked after. I was gutted when her shift finished! Once baby boy arrived and I was ready to move ward 17, I was looked after by Rachel, again she was friendly, professional and nothing was to much of a problem. It didn’t matter how many times I pressed my buzzer she was quickly there to help. The whole experience was unforgettable but positive with thanks to a fantastic team! I’ll forever be in your thanks for helping me to deliver my baby boy.

author: ChP20
title: Counselling service
body:
I met with a counsellor each week, she was very attentive to my needs and helped me to gain a clearer perspective of my problems and how to best deal with them. I am completely indebted to her, she has given me the necessary tools to help keep my mental health under control and deal with each problem as it arises instead of making assumptions about how a situation will develop.
Thank you for your help and patience, I appreciate it so much! 😊

author: ElA20
title: Admitted with Covid-19
body: My husband was admitted with Covid-19 and was luck to survive. He was admitted to ward 7D & cannot put into words how grateful he is to the nurses & domestic staff for caring for him like he was one of their own. It was hard not being able to see him but the warmth that you showed him was reassuring to me. Eternally grateful xx

readBy.name: East Renfrewshire Health & Social Care Partnership

author: DavieB
title: Helped me get through some very tough times
body: I have received treatment for leukemia for the last three and a half years at the Beatson hospital at Gartneval in glasgow mainly seen by Dr Heaney, The nurses in ward B7 and the day case/out patient wards. At all points during my treatment they have kept me up to speed, well informed and always kept me in positive mindset and helped me get through some obviously very tough times.

author: Telman
title: Mixed experience
body:
Long history of heart failure. Admitted with excellent care through A&E.  
Within 6 hours passed through Assessment Unit, another Assessment ward and ended up on D8, at last a glimpse of Sunlight and Greenery.  
A noisy night. Then a doctor who appeared not to have read my notes and certainly was not good at listening tried to treat me with a drug which had affected me badly 3 years before. I refused treatment, signed a self discharge and am fine at home.  
In short, marvellous A&E doctor and nurses, excellent nursing care throughout, but doctors should listen to patients.

readBy.name: St. Andrews University ScotGEM Medical Students
Office of Finlay Carson, MSP for Galloway and West Dumfries

title: Superlative Service from Women’s Services-…
body: From appointment making/confirmation, all done very quickly and within days of my own Dr’s referral, to a very polite & professional entry receptionist. Instantly greeted by a member of staff who took my details, temperature etc.. swiftly taken to a waiting area. Directed to X-ray for scan, on return instantly acknowledged and seen again by Doctor who clearly explained scan results. Prepared me for further tests. Having been before, I knew what to expect to some extent. Taken in for the invasive tests/biopsy with a super Dr and nurse practitioners, caring for me and distracting me. Left me to recover with an instant beverage and biscuits. Several staff checked on me and also the main Dr that was on duty who performed the tests/biopsy. Much appreciated. Nothing was too much trouble for them. Very attentive and aware. (And during Covid-19 times) They even catered for my biscuit preference - thank you. A really excellent display of care & professionalism from absolutely everyone in the dept., and also beyond in X-ray 1 (6/5/2020). Amazing team work. The NHS at its best. 5 STAR.  Thank you everybody for making the situation a very positive one.

readBy.name: Shrewsbury and Telford Hospital NHS Trust

title: Kindness, respect, patience & understanding.
body:
I'd been unable to visit a dentist due to very personal & trust issues.

I was in need of full dental clearance, which was daunting, but also such a relief to know I'd be out of constant pain. 
Once the teeth were out, It was around 6 months before my mouth had settled down & healed. 
In those 6 months, I still had the occasional appointment to get moulds made, colour & size chosen etc... 

At every appointment, I felt so at ease & relaxed. Their patience & understanding that was shown to me was outstanding. 
We practiced breathing exercises, I could go at my own pace & I built up the confidence & trust over the weeks & months I actually looked forward to my appointments. 

So when the time came for me to try the real set of dentures my anxiety levels were high. Prior to this, I'd has a wax set that were tweaked to fit my mouth. 
The real dentures were placed in my mouth & to tell the truth, it felt very odd but I was assured I'd get used to them. I did & I love them. 
They look so natural & fit me perfectly. They've given my the confidence I so lacked. 
I have been out for meals & I'd not been able to do that in years. 
I have a granddaughter now & I'm so happy to be able to smile, laugh & just be as natural with her & not be self conscious of those horrendous teeth I previously had. 

My treatment lasted around 18 months & I will forever be thankful to everyone who showed my their kindness, respect & understanding. They are such wonderful humans who will always have a special place in my heart. Thank you all. 

was tweaked etc colour chosen

title: Hard working staff
body: My days in the ICU was very comfortable the care they give you from day one till you leave is 100% they explained everything to me before doing anything I just can't thank you enough for saving my life from covid 19

title: Worst Reception and Service.
body: This issue has been going on for months. I am not able to get through to the reception. If I call , i have to wait for more than 15 minutes in the queue   and if I get through they just cut the line. Worst ever service from the reception team. Patients aren't able to contact the clinic for emergency appointments or medication issues. I have been with this clinic for 9 years now , but the last 1 year has dramatically changed and the worst service ever.

author: Ac81
title: Fantastic from start to finish
body:
I have just had baby number 3.  
My maternity care was provided by the midwifery team in oban and I gave birth in Paisley  
The Oban team were just fantastic from start to finish, there was continuity and a real feel of being involved and cared for to such a high standard. My assigned midwife was Rosie who I can’t praise enough although everyone has been great.  
Clearly the current climate is one no one could ever have planned for, it’s certainly not the kind of environment you want to give birth in, but everyone has been so calm and focused on providing good care, even where it has resulted In a huge change of working practices, the shift has been seamless. I gave birth in Paisley and was forewarned about the visiting restrictions in place however, as my induction date loomed I was dreading going in knowing my husband could only be present for a short period of time. However, the team in Paisley were also fantastic with the staff going above and beyond to put everyone at ease.  
I truly cannot thank everyone involved enough.

author: of-20
title: Dermatology bloods appointment during Covid-19
body:
I attended an appointment to have bloods taken today at the dermatology clinic. They were aware I am shielding (as immunosuppressed) and this was noted several times throughout the call. It was stated I would be guided into a "hub" for my bloods, again, specifically for patients who are shielding. I was to wait in the car until called in, which I did do.  
However, I was surprised to see the nurse was not wearing a mask or gloves when they came out to take in another patient who was waiting outside the entrance.  
The patient left, also not wearing a face mask.  
The nurse then came out, and called me in. I went inside to see a receptionist wearing a face mask, however the nurse who took my bloods had no mask, gloves, or apron. I didn't see the nurse wash, but assumed they surely must have.  
I should have said something at the time, but felt when I returned to the car I'll just sanitise my arm/hand that the nurse touched.  
And with further thought I decided to write to clarify what the procedures are regarding protocol during covid-19 pandemic.  
I've been shielding for nearly two months, so it was surprising to see the hygiene/safety slip in Burnside House during a pandemic - I’m immunocompromised and feel this was not acceptable.  
I hope future patients are treated with more caution and thought.

author: Banbridge relative
title: My elderly mother-in-law
body: My elderly 90 yr old mother-in-law fell in my home, my husband drove her immediately to Craigavon Area Hospital in excruciating pain, due to a recent chest infection and COPD we were redirected from Non Respiratory Emergency to the main Respiratory Emergency, where a very kind Ambulance Driver assisted her from our car into a chair and pushed her to reception, where a lovely lady took our details and a very short time later we were taken to Triage and immediately into a cubicle where she received most prompt, consideration and above all kind reassurance, a Dr ‘Peter’ was most helpful and gentle in his approach explaining exactly what was happening.She was taken to X-ray, lovely staff looking after her and again reassuring. She then had the news broken to her by Dr that the collarbone, shoulder and humerus were broken, surgery was not an option. Later admitted to 3 North at Craigavon, she is still currently in hospital, where we are updated frequently as to her condition, which is most comforting to us.I just want to put on record whilst our experience was one of admiration for these NHS workers, we can’t express enough our gratitude and appreciation in such dangerous and challenging circumstances they treated us with wonderful compassion. I can remember some of staff names unfortunately not all, but they were all remarkable ‘Trudie, Chris. I would love that these staff members would be personally told of our deep appreciation to all involved.

readBy.name: Southern Health and Social Care Trust

author: yuwdyas
title: Needle exchange
body: Was helpful, no problems.

author: Denny W
title: Minor surgical procedure
body:
Skin growth needed checking and decided by dermatology staff to remove and test.  
The reason I am putting my thoughts down is the caring, humorous and professional manner in which I was treated. During these difficult days this humour and professionalism is outstanding. As they say the NHS is open for business (out with Coronavirus) So my thanks to David and Katherine and the other staff I spoke to. Well done, you are a credit to yourselves and the NHS. Thanks again.

author: Autism mum warrior
title: My son was given excellent care
body:
Took my 20 year old son who has severe Autism and learning difficulties to the walk-in centre today.  
All 3 nurses he saw from reception, triage to receiving treatment were outstanding.  
My son was given excellent care!  
Well done to the team we are extremely grateful for your compassion especially in these difficult times.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2020)

author: Ajay
title: Inedible food
body: I am in the QE awaiting surgery. The staff and care are amazing but the food is the worst I have ever experienced. People should not be expected to eat food of such a low quality. It’s difficult enough being in hospital without being subjected to inedible food, I don’t know how patients can regain their strength if they can’t eat.

readBy.name: South Lanarkshire Health and Social Care Forum

author: My TAVI
title: My TAVI Procedure.
body:
I had a TAVI procedure carried out at the Golden Jubilee Hospital.  
I would like to take this opportunity to say a Huge Thank you to Dr.Mitchell Lindsay and all of the TAVI team, also, Thank you to all the Doctors, Nurses and all the staff of the CCU. Your skill, care and good humor was wonderful. I think the work you are all doing is fantastic, I extend these Thanks to the whole of the NHS on the front line.  
I feel like a new man, never been this healthy for years. I hope to see some of you soon when I come to the Golden Jubilee for my follow up appointment.  
Thank you all once again.

author: Roxy Rae
title: How low they made me feel
body: I was admitted to orthopedic d7 West and I feel that the way I was treated was disgusting. I felt that I was being put down and was made to feel awful by a member of staff. I was not offered pain relief and wasn't offered underwear even tho I had bladder problem and asked twice for some. I wasn't offered tea I had to wait 9 hours for a MRI and wasn't even given obs. I ended up walking out because of the way staff talked to me. Would I go there again - never in a million years.

title: Treatment useless; no communication for 48 days…
body:
Completed the initial assessment and was told I'd receive a treatment plan but despite me chasing I didn't receive any feedback for over a month. I was told an employee left the business so my case was just left pending but no real apology.

Another month delay which took the total to exactly 90 days between first assessment and treatment being scheduled and I'd given up with the service. 

Eventually I was given an online e-book with a few videos delivered through the Silvercloud online platform and it was so slow and basic it just annoyed me. You get a "supporter" who sends useful weekly guidance like "do the next module" and after 4 of these updates you get your "final review" so essentially your support is 40 mins (10 mins times 4 weeks) of some unknown person you never even speak to telling you to do your homework. 

This treatment option was so far removed from what I needed and B&H Wellbeing service so poor in their communication I can say with confidence it made my problems worse.

author: Bc17
title: My thanks and admiration
body:
I feel guilty that I haven't posted this before now, I don't know why. Under these terrible conditions, I should show my love and support to all at the jubilee better than this.  
However my first introduction to the hospital was in 2011, where under the care of the mighty Mr Pollock he replaced my aortic valve and I was up and out in 6 days, feeling like I'd been in a big trauma, and I can't put into words how much I owe Mr Pollock and all his amazing team for what they all did for me.  
Fast forward to 2019, Mr Nair saved my life when the valve had to be replaced again. 45 days in ICU I think. Every single person that I had helping me, especially Doctor Gemmell in Ayr and all the team in Ayr and Clydebank, for saving my life twice!  
My thanks and admiration to every single member of the NHS seems pitiful in the current situation, but it is heartfelt.

title: Poor experience due to receptionist and doctor
body: I would not recommend this practice to anyone the receptionist has no respect for privacy or dignity and the doctors do not care to involve you in your care, they do not want to discuss things but rather dictate things like you are a child.

title: excellent
body: An easy painless experience in these difficult Covid times.  All staff very professional, caring, attentive and everyone has a smile. Thank you very much.

readBy.name: Derbyshire Community Health Services NHS Foundation Trust

title: Fantastic Caring Staff
body: Admitted as an emergency case in the evening of 5 May 2020 direct into SCUDU Ward. During these challenging times for the whole of the NHS I was so impressed with how quickly i was admitted and reviewed. The Doctors and nurses where so attentive and quick to reassure. After one day  I was transferred to Beech A for ongoing treatment. All of the staff were excellent and with there caring nature you can only start to feel better. Everybody seemed part of a closely knitted team and this came across to the patients in all elements from cleaning right through to the Consultants. In these times it is so difficult for patients to have no contact through visits but again with the all the staff on this Ward they always had time for a chat or simply to fetch a bit drink. Eventually discharged on the 10 May but without the personnel involved i believe I would have been in hospital a lot longer. Many, many thanks to all staff on SCUDU and BEECH A. You are the best.

title: Ridiculous
body: Receptionist at this place are so unprofessional. I got the answer the doctor may get a message she might not what kind of answer is that. They think they are right with everything and you are wrong is just unacceptable. This place needs investigating.

title: Thank you to staff on Whippingham Ward
body: Please pass on my thanks and appreciation for the care my mother received on Whippingham Ward in early March 2020. My mother (who had a couple of previous admissions to Alverstone Ward in 2019 for a broken hip) was admitted to Whippingham Ward (via A & E and AMU) with a chest infection and UTI which required a lengthy course of strong antibiotics. Although this is a very busy ward, I was grateful to the Ward Sisters and medical staff for taking the time to discuss my mother's condition and options after her discharge.  Also, thanks to the many other staff who helped my mother make a good recovery.

title: Brilliant service
body: Saw accredited optician 21/12, pre op 28/12, op on right eye 8/1, op on left eye 11/3.  Same surgical team both ops, grateful thanks to all involved.  Highly recommended.  Friendly, helpful staff, spotless surroundings.

title: Great Experience
body: All staff from the moment we arrived we're so helpful, they honestly couldn't do enough for us. Myself and husband would highly recommend the maternity ward at Kingsmill Hospital for anyone planning on having a baby, the midwife's we're very friendly and supportive on this new experience of becoming a parent. The hospital itself is easy to find, modern and clean.

readBy.name: Sherwood Forest Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: Above & Beyond - Amazing Practice
body:
Further to a recent attendance and then a consequent RBH admission, I would like to pass on our sincerest thanks and gratitude to the staff at Chawton House. 
We currently find ourselves in unprecedented times and the impact of COVID19 is having a detrimental effect on many, however, our recent attendance to the Surgery evidenced the dedication of all the staff, at this most challenging time, and how you were all going above and beyond to ensure patients, in the local community, received all the care and support they needed.

Our sincerest gratitude for the dedication and determination you showed to care for not only myself but others too.

Keep safe, keep well and look after one another.

We are stronger together.

title: Great treatment but not good care!
body: Took my grandad to have his eye treatment. He said the treatment was great and the hospital were set up well to deal with Covid 19, however, they took him out the the car park and left him there. A different care park to where he was taken in, he is partially sighted and carrying a white stick, could not see where he needed to go. He tried to go back in to tell someone and they had locked the door. He cannot walk far and was really worried. Luckily he managed to find where we were but all unnecessary stress in an already difficult time. The nurse when he was taken to the entrance said that he would have help because we were unable to go in with him.

readBy.name: Doncaster and Bassetlaw Teaching Hospitals NHS Foundation Trust

title: WONDERFUL CARE
body: Hello. My Mum was taken to Peterborough Hospital by ambulance yesterday morning at 5am with chest pain. This isn't the first time this has happened, but this is the first time that I, her daughter, was unable to go with her because of Covid19.  The ambulance service (which arrived within 5 minutes) and the staff at the hospital were, as always, caring, kind, thorough and professional. I wanted to say thank you on behalf of my Mum and our family.  Thankfully she is home now after medication tweaks.  You truly are heroes!

readBy.name: North West Anglia NHS Foundation Trust

title: Great Practice
body: I am a care manager and most of our residents are registered with Albany practice. The practice has been very supportive during this periods of coronavirus pandemic. For example they donated visors and also arranged one of their GP to deliver  coronavirus questions and answer session that improves the knowledge of our staff and also boost their confidence to deliver effective and responsive care to all the residents of the care home .

title: Brilliant leadership
body:
My Mother is living at Birchwood and has been for the past 2 years. My Aunt lived here previously, so we already knew the home before our Mother needed residential care. 
The staff have always been very committed to their work and are doing a fantastic job to keep the home safe and free from the Covid-19 virus . The Management Team are very strong and focused on the care of the residents. They are all (the Manager in particular)  approachable and great listeners when as a family we have a worry or concern about our Mother or her care. They take note and action  immediately  to ensure her changing needs are met fully.  She is treated with respect and is comfortable and   happy here in her later years ( she is 96 years old ), and loves the food ! . 
I would recommend this establishment to anyone needed a safe caring home for a family member .

title: Great Service ..... but
body: .... staff and doctor are brilliant but! Try getting through by phone, it’s awful. Today I rang three times to talk to someone and got a recorded message “dial 111” and then you get cut off!!!  It’s rude, it’s not good enough and I’m surprised at the Castle Practice. Disappointed and unhelpful

title: Professional practice
body:
The telephonists are all very pleasant and helpful, the Doctors are quite simply excellent, very professional in every way.
I have no hesitation in recommending this practice.
Keep up the good work.

title: Great care provider
body:
I received absolutely  outstanding care and empathy from all staff on maternity ward when I had to have an overnight stay. 
Always reassured by staff about what was going on and what was going to happen next. Extremely friendly environment and spot I’ve environment. Thank you.

title: Urgent care department
body: The front desk reception team in the urgent care department are very unprofessional with how they speak to you. They lack knowledge on cross contamination and etiquette whilst dealing with patients. Laughing after mistakes that they caused (insensitive). Voicing their opinions on how they feel about patients is highly inappropriate there's a time and place to discuss matters and they were gossiping about me in their team I even heard one staff say “I don’t care you get the same treatment”. A staff nurse came out of a room and was communicating with another patient. He then saw me and instead of explaining anything he just said "hey what's your name" out loudly with no explanation, the treatment towards me was very poor. He then had a bad attitude and showed behaviours of being in a bad mood. I explained I had already done what he wanted to do he responded "this is a different department quite abruptly" he was so rude and unprofessional I was shocked that I was in a hospital, the level of service was poor. I would advise staff to attend training for customer care as it would be beneficial for the future. How you speak to patients, body language etc all needs to be professional at all times. Also the tone of voice for the person on front desk needs to be lower if the hospital was full everyone in there would know my full name, full address and reason I came in as they were asking questions so loudly. I've lost faith in the nhs. Also the doctor that I saw needs to listen instead of interrupting he didn’t want to listen to my history of medication just persisted on giving me a medication that is not suitable for me, no empathy was given. Going to the hospital was a waste of my time and made me lose trust and faith in the level of care provided.

title: Fantastic care
body:
The antenatal care I received at the Royal Oldham hospital was great from start to finish. When it came to the birth of our child, this continued. As someone who has never before been admitted to hospital, I was anxious when my birth plan for my first child (birth centre, water birth) changed a fortnight before my due date. I was to be induced. In the current climate, I also learnt that I would have to go through the majority of the process alone, without my birth partner, due to visitor restrictions. 
From arriving at the antenatal ward at lunchtime on a Tuesday, to leaving with my newborn on Thursday afternoon, the care we received from the staff was exemplary. The induction process was not an easy one, with the medication having too much of an effect and bringing on too many contractions. The antenatal staff acted quickly to move me to the labour ward as a result. I am grateful to the student midwife who held my hand and spoke to my partner on the phone, as I was very emotional by this point. Once there, I was mainly under the care of two professional, kind and caring midwives during my stay, who could not have been better. They really did go above and beyond - from providing refreshments and a bed for my partner, to setting up a starlight lamp when they heard that this was not the relaxed, birth centre birth I had had planned until very recently. I felt informed and supported throughout, even when the labour did not progress as planned and I was advised by the doctors that my baby may need to be born instrumentally, or even via c-section, which I had been desperate to avoid. 
The surgical team put my mind at rest at a very anxious time, with one of the before mentioned midwives by my side, and a member of the surgical staff providing me much reassurance. The surgeon who delivered our baby using forceps kept me informed every step of the way, and delivered our baby quickly.
We cannot thank the staff who cared for us during this time enough. We are grateful that they brought our baby into the world with such care and professionalism. We would not hesitate to use the department again, and we would recommend them to anyone.

title: Super Efficient Service
body:
I had a concern over the weekend that I wanted to get some advice on. 
I went onto the website which I found very easy to navigate.
I left details of my enquiry and my contact details in the hope that someone would message me back by the close of business on Monday.
I was delighted to receive a reply early on Monday morning informing me that one of the Doctors would  telephone me at a specific time which was within an hour of her message. 
The Doctor was very helpful and offered me some much needed reassurance.
Bearing in mind how difficult things are during this Coronavirus pandemic the Doctors, Nurses and all clerical members of staff at The Fountain Practice are doing an amazing job.

author: BLESSED MOTHERHOOD
title: Wonderful Fertility Journey
body:
I had been suffering from infertility for six years. After two miscarriages and several visits to different fertility centres, I reached the fertility centre at Croydon University Hospital.  
Here the entire team led by Dr Shubha was very considerate, affectionate and helpful. The love and care I received here made me believe that I could become a mother. Anna helped me with all the details of the medicines and injections that are a part of the IVF marathon.  
Today I am a mother of a healthy 10 month old baby girl and I thank this team in my heart everyday. I hope they continue with all the good work. Lots of luck and my best wishes to the Fertility team.  
Regards  
Anchal Sinha

title: Amazing staff
body:
My first experience of Gravesham community hospital.
After having an X-ray was referred to  to Minor injuries department.
Greeted @ reception as was expected.
Seen within 40 minutes , treated and sent back to x-ray where I was seen within 5 mins , back to Minor injuries patched up and left department.
All the staff were very efficient but made me feel relaxed, calm  and made light of my injury.
Lovely professional staff . 
Would say I would go there again if need to but hope it's not in the near future as it's not a nice experience having a dislocated toe !

readBy.name: Kent Community Health NHS Foundation Trust

title: Such helpful service
body:
During the coronavirus pandemic St Stephens Gate are offering online and telephone consultations, organised through the website. I have spoken to the practice three times in the last five weeks and they have been so kind and helpful, and very quick to respond to my queries (always within the two days specified on the website, if not sooner). Staff have always done their best to understand and answer my queries, and I felt reassured after every consultation. 

The practice must be under a lot of pressure at the moment, and I so admire and appreciate the way they are handling it and making sure everyone can receive the help they need.

title: Confused at first
body:
I was initially annoyed when trying to access services at Monkspath surgery which closed suddenly around mid March 2020 due to Covid 19.  Notices had quickly been put up on the outside of the surgery but left customers somewhat confused on how we could access the service.

Eventually I found an appropriate number to ring and after a long introduction was put through to be triaged at Shirley Health Centre.   I was number 16 in the queue, to my surprise I didn’t have to wait too long.  The person that answered my enquiry, which was on behalf of my father was pleasant and reassuring and advised me I would receive a call from a doctor.  

The doctor advised me to bring my father into the surgery that afternoon, subsequently I have used the service again and felt it quite an efficient way of dealing with enquiries and far more private.  

From my initial scepticism I do think it is a useful way of accessing GP services.  For others, approaching the service is preferable.  Booking on line is another method but in my haste I did not even consider it.  Probably a bit more publicity around this area of access would be helpful.

title: Emergency Dental
body: I visited the practice for an emergency dental treatment. I had an xray done and the dentist suggested to arrange an appointment for a root canal treatment at another hospital. I asked to be provided with the x-ray but after calling twice I have not yet received the scan and am being directed to 111 to ask for the scan. The outcome is that I cannot receive the scan and i will have to re-expose myself to another x-ray.

title: Cant thank the staff enough
body:
Gave birth here in april. Had a c-section and was extremely nervous with all that is going on at the moment with coronavirus. From the minute i arrived on the ward i was put at ease and staff introduced themselves letting me know what will be happening and when. Although they were extremely busy they always found a few minutes to stop and chat. Even in theatre i felt relaxed and all the staff were brilliant even having a laugh which made the whole experience so.much better. In recovery me and baby was looked after so well and again even though they were run off there feet we were always seen if needed and asked if we needed anything. 
While i was there i saw staff giving up there breaks to make sure things were okay and were running on time. I cant thank them enough for the care me and my baby recieved especially at a time like this. They dont get the recognition they deserve.

title: Great practice
body: My experience is always great here, lovely staff that book you in and the nurses always help you feel as ease. Thank you all

title: Great service
body: Great service from all at the Hattersley group  practice, Hyde. They have looked after me for the last few years and I have received great service from everyone here. On this particular occasion,I was having problems with a medication that was hard to obtain/ out of stock, problems at the chemist etc, I explained the situation with my practice and was assured that this would be resolved. The next day I got a call to say this was sorted and with the pharmacy. This is typical of the service you get. During these worrying times we live in at the moment I think they do an amazing job looking after all the patients in difficult circumstances.

author: JB87
title: Miscarriage support from caring midwives
body:
I am currently going through medical management for an early missed miscarriage. I feel the need to give praise to the incredible staff at the scanning department and Rubislaw ward at AMH for being so lovely.  
At the end of April I had to attend Antenatal scanning for my dating scan on my own due to the pandemic. We didn’t have a clue how far along I was as this was a lovely surprise with it not happening after over 5 years of trying. I feel terrible because, given the terrible circumstances of our situation, I don’t remember anyone’s names despite everyone introducing themselves very professionally. I was seen at 1pm upstairs for my scan and the woman scanning me was so empathetic and apologetic as she explained ‘baby’ wasn’t growing as it should in comparison to my gestational sac. This was devastating and made all the more worse as my husband wasn’t there with me. She was so incredibly empathetic and they allowed me to leave via a side door so I didn’t t need to pass lots of people as I was visibly upset. They arranged a scan in Rubislaw a week later.I attended Rubislaw for my scan in the morning. Again, terribly upset that I had to walk that corridor on my own I began to cry. The midwife was so lovely (I’m so sorry I can’t remember her name) and apologised that she couldn’t give me a hug because of the pandemic. But her words were soothing and I already felt at ease. She undertook the scan with a doctor present and they explained what had happened in detail and I was able to ask questions. I was reassured that it was not my fault and that someone would speak to me about my options. I was taken through to the garden room which is beautiful and very calming. Another lovely midwife and student midwife came in to the garden room and they spoke very clearly about the options whilst reassuring me there was no rush to make my decision and I could return tomorrow after having some time to think to discuss further if I wished. The midwife couldn’t have been more caring and compassionate given my circumstances. I made the decision for medicine management and I was asked to return the next morning. The next morning I had the same midwife who made sure I was 100% sure about the decision before it was taken any further. Everything was explained to me again. I was given the medication, anti sickness and pain relief and given more pain relief for home. The midwife clearly explained what to expect and told me multiple times that if I had any concerns at all to not hesitate to contact them.I feel most upset that I can’t remember the midwives name as she was professional whilst also showing such care and compassion towards me. Even though we are struggling through this difficult situation, ALL the staff who have cared for me through the whole process have been incredible. I cannot thank them enough for all the reassurance, kind words, care, compassion and empathy shown towards me. Thank you to the scanning department and Rubislaw Ward from a very grateful patient.

readBy.name: Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2020)

author: Jester
title: Aberdeen Maternity Triage Team
body:
I have attended triage a few times now at the Maternity Hospital and the team are very friendly, thorough and put you at ease. They don't mess about and get you down to get checked out quickly. Great team of midwives.  
One thing that was slightly confusing was despite all the midwives being kitted out in PPE there was a nurse who was dealing with patients with none on at all (no mask etc). Partners cannot currently accompany mums for infection risk so surely all staff should have to follow the same PPE rules when dealing with patients to minimise the same risk?

author: silverwarefk96
title: No need to worry about level of care
body: had an mri scan yesterday and despite feeling a little anxious about going to the hospital at this time I need not of worried. I was given a time to be at the duck pond and was then escorted by a lovely chap to the room. I honestly could not have been more wrapped in safety cotton wool and the people in that department were friendly and looked after me professionally honestly no one need worry about there care. Thank you NHS

author: Bigaal
title: End of life care covid 19
body:
I want to thank all staff involved looking after my mum from admission to the end of life. From the paramedics, SATA resus unit and ward 15 at the RAH. All staff where fantastic, supportive and informative with every step of my mum's care. I especially want to thank Lynne (who was my rock in the end), amanda, karen and STudent nurse Laura. All the staff where brillant and sorry I can not remember the names of everyone.  
I also want to give thanks to Barbara the palliative care CNS who in the end made sure there was no pain or suffering. This has given me and my family great comfort.  
As a nurse myself it was lovely to see above and beyond care in a time which bring pressures to us all. I would like to say all NHS staff are heroes but these people will hold a place in heart forever.

readBy.name: University of Glasgow - School of Medicine, Dentistry and Nursing

author: Jem91
title: Counselling for depression due to unresolved issues
body: My counsellor Ian was extremely helpful. He helped me see that all it takes is to see things differently and learn to accept things that cannot be changed. I am so grateful that with his help I was able to finally make peace with some issues that I had been dealing with for years! I really recommend anyone who is thinking about counselling to go for it. I cannot explain to you how much it helps.

title: An Excellent Practice
body:
Everyone is extremely polite and helpful. Me and my family is seen by a particular doctor who knows are medical history well, so have complete faith in her diagnosis.
Even when in an emergency appointment with a locum doctor, they have been very good.
The waiting time has gone less and getting an appointment has been really easy and the phone is picked up according to the queue and a very helpful by the team. 
Have full trust and faith in the surgery, will not like to go anywhere else.
Kind Regards
Anita Singh

title: Great patient care & treatment
body:
I visited as an out patient. 
First to imaging & then to urology. 
My treatment was first class. 
Everyone I met was professional, kind, caring & highly efficient. At no point did I feel confused or anxious. All of my questions were answered calmly & clearly, explaining next steps. 
All of this at a time when the NHS are under extreme pressure with Covid 19. 
Thank you so much, so lucky to have this facility local to me.

title: Terrible service
body: I had a consultation in this practice in November 2019. After my consultation a referral should have been sent to QA. Spire never bothered to send over my referral and despite countless phone calls they just divert you back to Qa and you never get any answers. I payed £180 for this consultation for a referral that didn't get sent across until 7 months later! and no one would tell me what was going on. They are completely negligent and if you have any issues with a certain doctor not doing their job properly Spire won't help you, they just close ranks and say that they just hire out the room to the doctor and won't look into your queries. It is also impossible to get in contact with the doctor directly to find out what's going on. Not only did they waste my money but they also caused me much upset and stress and I would strongly recommend not using the private health care service.

title: Rude staff
body: Very rude staff both doctors and receptionists. They don't communicate effectively to the patient what is going on, talk between themselves in different language making patient uncomfortable and make patient feel upset and in tears at end of the appointment due to the bad attitudes.

title: Horrible practice
body:
I have been a patient of this practice for many years and never have I been subject to the awful care that I recently experienced. The female doctor at this practice should be investigated and CQC really look at her GP skills. You read so many terribly reviews about her and yet she continues to treat patients with such disrespect and her non existent compassion for people 
I have left that surgery in tears on the last 3 occasions and people should not be made to feel this way 
The practice is dirty, the facilities are disgusting and the previous 2 GPs who had the surgery for many years would be really upset.
You get passed from pillar to post and no one ever really seems to know what they are doing, you call to enquire about prescriptions and you just get excuses and terrible service on the phone.
It’s just a sorry state of affairs at this practice and it really needs to be taken seriously before something serious happens to people

title: Life Saver
body:
Admitted to ICU with severe breathing issues, not COVID, thankfully!! Serious Pneumonia!!
Put onto ventilator, the consultant, nurses and staff saved my life with the speed and care of treatment. on vent for around 3 weeks. came around quickly and onto Walnut Ward. I am by far the worse patient but the care and patience shown was our of this world. I managed to get Delirium, which affected me badly, some of the. Again, cannot state how amazing the doctors and nurses were. The ward was clean, well aired and the food was really good. Physio also quite incredible. If ever I have health issues in future, its the only place I would attend. My thanks and that of my family go to all. Finally, my apologises again for being such and poor patient.

readBy.name: North West Anglia NHS Foundation Trust

title: The best
body:
I have been with this practice for decades.  My children too. Always pleasant and friendly, the reception staff are efficient, whilst also juggling complicated diaries/emergencies also very friendly (something not seen everywhere I note!). 

Doctor is absolutely professional, and you always feel listened to, with the right level of information given about all medical queries.  Tests and investigations are instigated at the right moments.  I have always felt properly looked after. 

I would not hesitate to recommend this practice, especially those who need kind and attentive medical care, and also those with children.

title: BEST SURGERY IN THE AREA
body: This surgery has left me astounded. Every aspect of my complex care and history is outstanding, this literally the Harrods of the area. All the staff should be proud of their work and surroundings. Well done.

title: Awful!
body:
I am completely amazed by all the positive reviews! 

Half the time it's almost impossible to get through on the phone - and when I do, I have the joy of speaking to receptionists that are incredibly rude and unhelpful.

Then when actually getting an appointment, it is rare that I am seen within 30 minutes. 

All the nurses I've seen have been lovely, a few of the Drs have also been great, but some of the other Drs are really quite questionable! I have had to continously battle over my medication & the lack of care I have received is truly outstanding, so I am looking to join a different GP.

title: Excellent service
body: During Covid I had a telephone consultation. Very efficient with the GP calling me at home. Answered all queries. I hope they continue with telephone consultations, if appropriate, as sometimes this is all you need rather than taking up valuable GP time.

title: Brilliant care from GP surgery and Conquest…
body:
I had a breast problem. I had a telephone consultation with my GP at The Old Town Surgery Bexhill on a Wednesday, the Conquest hospital contacted me on the Thursday Offering an appointment the following Monday. Scans, examinations and results all dealt with within two hours on the Monday. Extremely well planned procedures, brilliant planning from start to finish and all undertaken at a difficult time for everyone. 
At every level, from GP receptionist to the staff at the Breast clinic, the staff were calm, helpful, knowledgable and professional. The clinic was well organised taking into account all the new social distancing and additional cleaning needed. I couldn’t have asked for better treatment and I’m extremely grateful to all concerned.

title: Rubbish
body: Get medical advice wrong on several occasions whereby ended up in hospital did not help with request for prescription was rude and not at all helpful

title: Efficient, professional and quick access
body: I am very impressed with how quickly I was seen after completing my self-referral. The physiotherapist I saw was very professional and knowledgeable and explained my condition clearly to me. I found having the exercises emailed to me particularly useful. Great service!

title: Brilliant service
body: Phoned PM 11th May for a phone call from a doctor. Got one within 5 mins. Appointment with hospital made within 30 mins. Letter of confirmation and details arrived AM 12th May . All completed in less than 20 hours - incredible.

title: Excellent care and speedy diagnosis
body: I came into AandE just after 9am on a Sunday morning in a great deal of pain. Everyone from the checking in team to the porters were fabulous. The doctors got me quickly to xray and to an mri, making sure I was comfortable all the way. An instant referral to orthopedics meant my injury was quickly diagnosed and I was given the option of admission or wait at home for emergency surgery. Everything was clearly explained at all stages and the right questions asked to be able to make a quick assessment. I was very pleased with my treatment.

title: Very kind and supportive team
body: I had emergency surgery and everyone from the cleaning staff to the surgical staff are clearly working together as 'one team' to make sure the hospital works together at this difficult time. I was given clear options and advice for anaesthesiology and pain relief, a detailed explanation of my surgery and what the next steps were. The surgical team were really friendly and the ward team also. The nursing and support staff on the ward were really excellent. They were genuinely so kind, particularly to the older and some times more confused patients, and very thoughtful in their approach. I had a very painful injury and the QA team were just marvelous.

author: Rgab2020
title: Care given to our Mum
body: We would like to highlight a real gem in the MHOAT team. Registered nurse Lisa. She has been a fantastic support to our Mum over the last couple of years. Nothing has been too much trouble for her, she has the perfect manner for this type of work, not only has she built up a supportive relationship with our Mum, we are very grateful to her and find her warm approachable manner extremely helpful in difficult times.

author: sarahrecovery
title: Anorexia treatment
body: I have had treatment at St Georges Eating Disorder services for the last few years, of which I have had only negative experiences. I find the staff are unfriendly, patronising, condescending and unhelpful. I also feel they are unsympathetic towards mental health struggles I am experiencing, and do not present a welcoming service to help me recover from my illness and issues.

readBy.name: Sheffield Health and Social Care NHS Foundation Trust
Imperial College, BSc Humanities, Philosophy & Law (2020)
Yorkshire & Humber Patient Safety Research Collaboration

author: AStevensonB
title: Pregnancy and Labour
body:
This is my 2nd pregnancy and we were cared for throughout by Lorna from the Blue Team within the the RAH, Paisley. Lorna was the most supportive, helpful and incredibly kind midwife we could have asked for. She visited at home which also made me feel a lot more relaxed and meant I didn't need to worry about childcare. It was also Lorna who visited me at home after I had my baby and the continuity was very much appreciated and again made me feel more relaxed as I already had a relationship with her, so no question felt like a stupid question. It was also reassuring as being in lockdown and anxious about covid 19, it meant only one health care staff member in my house, rather than different people on each visit.  
During labour we were cared for by Debi and Kelli and both of them were amazing. I had a very quick labour and they were both so calm and supportive throughout and I can't thank them enough for delivering my little baby girl. Debi looked after me before and after I gave birth as well and was so helpful and reassuring, especially in the current circumstances whereby my husband could only stay a short time after delivery.  
Other staff who helped whilst I was in hospital and I want to thank include: Jacqueline (triage midwife who was so understanding when I went in), Christine (Labour ward who induced me), Erin (student who looked after me in labour ward after delivery and was so patient with all my questions! ).

author: RI90
title: Induction during COVID 19
body:
I was in for an induction at Wishaw general hospital on Wednesday night for my second baby and I just wanted to leave this here not only to highlight the work of the staff but for any other expectant mothers that may be nervous about going into a hospital to have their baby to try and put them at ease.  
When I arrived I was shown to a 4 bed ward that was to be shared between two of us but I was then moved to a single room where there were staff available to start off my induction process while the other woman in my ward was being assessed. I subsequently stayed in this single room for my whole induction and labour. Firstly all of the midwifery staff that were looking after my needs were absolutely fantastic with several apologising for having to wear masks. All of the staff took it so seriously and took it all in their stride. I want to give a particular thank you to Lorna and Anne along with the two student midwives who were working alongside them Darcey and Emma. Lorna and Darcey helped me massively through the beginning of the induction process and immediately put my mind at ease. On the change of shift Anne and Emma helped me through the remainder to the birth of my baby. I unfortunately had a bit of a difficult labour and was nearly taken to theatre to allow me to deliver my baby and if it hadn’t been for Anne and Emma and the doctor Hilary that came in to help I wouldn’t have managed to deliver my baby myself without the need for any instruments.  
My whole experience, while I wasn’t expecting a negative experience I was unsure of what my care would be like due to COVID 19, ended up being such a positive and wonderful experience for me and it is all down to the extra care and professionalism shown by all of the midwifery staff and I can’t thank everyone enough for making my memories of this birth into something positive.  
My husband while not allowed in for the beginning of the induction was allowed in after my waters were broken and up to 6 hours after our baby boy was born which gave him a chance to bond with our baby before me and baby got discharged from hospital.  
A massive thank you again to all of the maternity staff at Wishaw general hospital for such a wonderful experience.
